Update - Carrollton Schools will be offering three learning options for students. Click the link below for our Parent Learning Options form!

1: We will return to school in a traditional format, with appropriate safety measures, five days per week.

2: Google Classroom Remote Learning:
- Remote Setting From Home
- Students choosing Option 2 will have the benefit of being taught by a Carrollton Teacher.
- Students will check in daily on Google Classroom and complete assignments and assessments by scheduled due dates.
- Instruction provided by Carrollton Teachers through Google Classroom (free to families)

3: Digital Academy:
- Remote Setting From Home
- Students learn remotely without direct instruction from a Carrollton Teacher. This program resembles our current Warrior Digital Academy.
- Self-guided/Self-paced
- Instruction provided through a purchased curriculum (Acellus) taught by certified teachers (free to families)

However, if children are sad, irritable, or no longer enjoy things, and this occurs day after day, it may be a sign that they are suffering from major depressive disorder, commonly known as depression.

Kick off #NationalParkWeek with National Junior Ranger Day! The Junior Ranger Program is a great way to explore national parks. You can learn about nature sounds, night skies, or even the Transcontinental Railroad! You'll also learn why national parks matter and how you can be a part of the team that helps keep parks healthy.

We don't care what age you are—just "explore, learn, and protect" your national parks online and become an official Junior Ranger! Look for the virtual badges you can print out and post on your refrigerator. Learn more at https://www.nps.gov/kids/junior-ranger-online.htm

#FindYourVirtualPark #JuniorRangerDay

Text of the all-call message sent this evening from Superintendent David Quattrochi.

Dear Parents and Community Members,
After consultation with the Ohio Department of Health, Ohio Governor Mike DeWine announced today a recommendation to keep K-12 schools open. However, schools should prepare in case they do close in the future and parents should also be prepared for the possibility of needing to stay home with their children.

Effective immediately, our school district will be following the listed recommendations:
- All out-of-state trips are cancelled until further notice (including the New York trip)

This past weekend 23 Carrollton Middle School band and choir students participated in the Ohio Music Education Association District 8 Junior High Honors Band and Honors Choir. The festival was held at Alliance High School on November 23, 2019, and featured some of the best junior high musicians from 22 local school districts. Students worked two Saturdays in preparation for this event and had the opportunity to be taught by top-tier directors and guest conductors from the state of Ohio.

The faculty of Carrollton Schools was well-represented as Mr. Jordan Provost, assistant choir and band director at Carrollton Schools was the coordinator of the OMEA D8 JH Honors Choir. In addition, Mr. David Dickerhoof, head band director at Carrollton Schools, assisted in teaching percussion sectionals for the OMEA D8 JH Honors Band. #WarriorPride
